words.def: a safe place
a submerged ridge of rock or coral near the surface of the water
people who are free
A companion, comrade or friend.
an instinctive motive
A shiver, a shudder.
One of a flight of steps.
(British informal) an airless smoky smelly atmosphere
the dressed hairy coat of a mammal
(sports) the chief official (as in boxing or American football) who is expected to ensure fair play
Land held in feudal tenure.
a fixed charge for a privilege or for professional services
floor covering consisting of a piece of thick heavy fabric (usually with nap or pile)
a cgs unit of work or energy
A hard surface of rock fragments set in a sandy matrix, found in some hot deserts.
a unit of force equal to the force exerted by gravity
European strong-scented perennial herb with grey-green bitter-tasting leaves
A state of befuddlement; intoxication.
Library American Library Association  abbreviation for forty-eighth, a book size 7. 5-10 cm in height; a book of that height.
a rare heavy polyvalent metallic element that resembles manganese chemically and is used in some alloys
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
